description: A new Android banking malware named 'SoumniBot' is using a less common obfuscation approach by exploiting weaknesses in the Android manifest extraction and parsing procedure. [...]
title: SoumniBot malware exploits Android bugs to evade detection

description: The U.S. Justice Department charged Moldovan national Alexander Lefterov, the owner and operator of a large-scale botnet that infected thousands of computers across the United States. [...]
title: Moldovan charged for operating botnet used to push ransomware

description: Cisco has released patches for a high-severity Integrated Management Controller (IMC) vulnerability with public exploit code that can let local attackers escalate privileges to root. [...]
title: Cisco discloses root escalation flaw with public exploit code

description: The Sandworm hacking group associated with Russian military intelligence has been hiding attacks and operations behind multiple online personas posing as hacktivist groups. [...]
title: Russian Sandworm hackers pose as hacktivists in water utility breaches

description: Cybersecurity firms commonly sell "dark web monitoring" packages, with firms having slighly different features. Learn from Flare about the different dark web monitoring packages and the value they bring to your organization. [...]
title: Dark Web Monitoring: What's the Value?

description: At least six distinct botnet malware operations are hunting for TP-Link Archer AX21 (AX1800) routers vulnerable to a command injection security issue reported and addressed last year. [...]
title: Multiple botnets exploiting one-year-old TP-Link flaw to hack routers

description: Microsoft says the new Copilot app, mistakenly added to the list of installed Windows apps by recent Edge updates, doesn't collect or relay data to its servers. [...]
title: Microsoft: Copilot ‘app’ on Windows Server mistakenly added by Edge

description: Starting today, millions living in the UK will receive email invitations to sign up for an e-visa account that will replace their physical immigration documents like Biometric Residence Permits (BRPs). The move is, according to the Home Office, "a key step in creating a modernised and digital border." [...]
title: UK e-visa rollout begins today: no more immigration cards for millions

description: Starting today, millions living in the UK will receive email invitations to sign up for an e-visa account that will replace their physical immigration documents like Biometric Residence Permits (BRPs). title: UK e-visa rollout starts today for millions: no more physical immigration cards
